Description: Plaque, rectangular; painted Limoges enamel on copper: Scene from the Life of St Anthony Abbot. St Anthony identified by the Tau cross on his robes. An archer and 7 monks playing bowls in a rocky landscape. At lower right within a laurel wreath, the coat of arms of Jean de Langeac, Bishop of Limoges. Painted on black preparation or directly on to copper in semi-opaque enamel and over foil in translucent enamels of green-blue and orange-brown; details gilt. Counter-enamel an opaque flux.
Curator's comments: The story is that of the parable of the hunter's bow, as explained in the Life of St Anthony Abbot in the Golden Legend. Not listed in Verdier's handlist of BM enamels. See notes for 1922, 0707.1, and bibliography, pl. 17. In set with 1922,0707.1
Bibliographic references: Baratte, 1993 / Léonard Limosin au musée du Louvre (plate 18)
